newsitem.title: THAILAND: Thai stocks seen up in line with Wall Street.
newsitem.headline: Thai stocks seen up in line with Wall Street.

text.p: Thai stocks were expected to rise in line with gains on Wall Street and several Asian markets early on Tuesday, brokers said.

The SET Index ended 2.53 points lower at 967.77 on Monday. Brokers said the appointment of Chavalit Yongchaiyudh as premier late on Monday would not have any effect since the market already knew it would happen following the November 17 election.

"The SET should rise today following gains on Wall Street overnight and several Asian markets. Also, signs of a cut in U.S. interest rates which will affect Thailand will also help boost the SET," a broker said.
